result.execSummary:
The defendant Hope R Belzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hope R Belzer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hope R Belzer was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Hope R Belzer was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Hope R Belzer was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
Subject to good time and work release.  Credit for 281 days = time served.

Must provide DNA sample at the Polk County Sheriff's Department.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms.
